p: Complex polymer blends with many ingredients pose a challenge for formulation design. Hamaguchi et al. [12] tackled this by preparing 537 cleansing-foam formulations (mixtures of surfactants, polyols, etc.) and using ML to predict their cleansing performances. They computed molecular descriptors (including Hansen solubility parameters) for each formulation and trained five ML models. The best model achieved R2≈0.770 in predicting cleansing capability. Importantly, the study also used in silico design: it generated and screened virtual formulations with the trained model. Despite highly nonlinear ingredient interactions, this AI-assisted approach identified promising ingredient combinations, illustrating how ML can guide the optimization of “super-multicomponent” polymer products.
